div.head: Capitulum 7
On the immersion, how often it ought to happen.
div.p: Concerning the immersion if it were asked how it ought to be done precisely, we respond: either one time, or three times, according to the different custom of the Church.

Whence
Gregory :
Concerning the threefold immersion of baptism, nothing truly is able to be responded than what you have sensed; because in one faith diverse customs of the Holy Church impede nothing. For because there is one substance subsisting in three things, it is in no way able to be reprehensible that an infant is immersed in baptism three times or one time, because both the Trinity of persons is able to be designated in the threefold immersion, and the singularity of the divine is able to be designated in the one immersion. But we, who immerse in three, also mark the sacrament with the sign of a three day burial.
Gregorius, XXX
.
For according to this it is permissible to immerse not in the mode of three, but also only once.

Nevertheless it is permissible to immerse one time, where such a custom of the Church exists. But if someone begins to do it, where such a custom does not exist, or asserts that someone should be immersed only one time, then they are doing something worthy of reproach.

Whence Haymo:
In this sense Cyprian abounds, since he was immersing children only one time in baptism; who was fulfilling because he was understanding zealously, by abounding with good works, though in this he unknowingly was erring. But because he was abounding in good works, afterward, having been corrected by God, he abounded in a higher sense, by immersing them three times.
Haymo, Expost. in Epist. ad Rom 14:5 (PL 117, 488) .
Behold you have because he fails who immerses one time; but this was therefore, the custom of the Church was otherwise or because he was asserting only one immersion should be made.

Concerning threefold immersion
Augustine
says:
After we promise to believe we dip our head in the holy font a third time, in whatever way the order of baptism is celebrated with a double signification of the mystery For you have rightly been immersed a third time, who have received the baptism in the name of the Trinity. You are immersed rightly a third time who have received the baptism in the name of Christ, who was resurrected from the dead on the third day. For this immersion repeated a third time expresses the type of lordly burial
Sermo De mysterio baptismi (PL 40, 1211) .

Therefore it stands that those being baptized should be immersed a third time; and nevertheless if they are immersed only once, they still truly receive baptism. And the one who immerses only once, does not sin, unless they oppose the custom of the Church, or assert that it ought to be done only in this mode.
